intro: Pasania auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate pasania, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, green, oval-shaped leaves with a distinctive ear-shaped base. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
